Advisory.Title: mod_php: ini_restore() safe_Mode and open_basedir restriction bypass vulnerability
Advisory.Summary: PHP 5 up to 5.1.6 allows local users to bypass certain Apache HTTP Server httpd.conf options, such as safe_mode and open_basedir, via the ini_restore function, which resets the values to their php.ini (Master Value) defaults.

Description.p: According to a security advisory from Maksymilian Arciemowicz, a vulnerability exists in the programming language PHP which allows local users to bypass certain Apache HTTP server "httpd.conf" options, such as "safe_mode" and "open_basedir", via the "ini_restore" function, which resets the values to their "php.ini" (master value) defaults.
